title: Chili Oil
source: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
categories: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
ingredients: - 2 tablespoons Sichuan peppercorns, coarsely ground, divided
- 1 (1-inch) piece ginger, sliced into ¼-inch-thick rounds and smashed
directions: Directions:1. Combine chili flakes, sesame seeds, half of the peppercorns, and salt in a heatproof bowl.

2. In a small saucepan over low heat, cook the oil, ginger, star anise, cardamom, bay leaves, and the remaining peppercorns, stirring occasionally, until the spices have darkened and the mixture is very fragrant, 25 to 30 minutes.
3. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into the bowl with the chili flake mixture (it may bubble slightly); discard the solids.
4. Stir well to combine. Let sit at room temperature until the flavors meld, about 12 hours, before using.
5. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 months; the flavor will continue to mature over time.
